Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2007 01:46AM sputnik wrote: Hi Dorothy. My surgeon had ordered a post-op CT and a "suspicious" spot appeared. Thanks to all of your quick support, I have once again doned my battle gear.
Posts.Title: Concern has shifted from Breast to Liver cancer sputnik The_Cyber_Cat

Posts.Content: sputnik wrote: Hello, my partial in the breast was an absolute success!! Hooray! Clear margins and no limpnodes affected. It was discovered that only 25% of folks have cancer as aggresive as mine, and I'm due to start chemo soon, but felt as though it was down-hill from here. Oh oh, spot discovered on liver....kaboom...and my oncologist outright told me that if it's cancer, I will be dead in 2 years!! So I am now waiting for the results of my liver biopsy and frantically looking for some hope. Also trying to find a new oncologist. Anyone in a similair situation? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Concern has shifted from Breast to Liver cancer sputnik The_Cyber_Cat

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2007 01:30AM sputnik wrote: Thanks Kate. I'm really trying to focus on the fact that this liver thing could just be my affinity for Southern Comfort. Har-har...bartender....occupational hazard. I've decided to subject myself to an unusually long wait period for the results,however, as I refuse to see that oncologist again. I'll take the news from whoever my new one turns out to be. Love the pooch photo, and don't you just love that we can avoid kids during chemo but still sleep with our dogs?
Posts.Title: Concern has shifted from Breast to Liver cancer sputnik The_Cyber_Cat

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2007 01:39AM sputnik wrote: Wow!! Thank you everyone for leg up. This is an absolutely fabulous forum....don't know why I didn't post earlier. This is what I needed to regain my focus...seems that Ativan does nothing for me so you guys are my new drug. And nada but great side effects!!!
